<script language="Javascript" type="text/javascript"> 
<!--
<!--Start Contribution List-->
	function dbt_vbd_checkem(obj)
	{
		arrInput = document.getElementsByTagName("input");
		for (i=0; i<arrInput.length; i++) 
		{
			if (arrInput[i].type == 'checkbox') 
			{
				arrInput[i].checked = obj.checked;
			}
		}
	}
	function dbt_vbd_conf()
	{
		if (document.dbt_vbdmdf.dbt_vbd_mdf.value=='confirm')
		{
			dbt_vbd_agree = confirm('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_confirmed_warning}');
		}
		if (document.dbt_vbdmdf.dbt_vbd_mdf.value=='unconfirm')
		{
			dbt_vbd_agree = confirm('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_unconfirmed_warning}');
		}
		if (document.dbt_vbdmdf.dbt_vbd_mdf.value=='delete')
		{
			dbt_vbd_agree = confirm('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_delete_warning}');
		}
		if (document.dbt_vbdmdf.dbt_vbd_mdf.value=='changegroup')
		{
			<vb:if condition="($vboptions[dbtech_vbdonate_usergroup_type]=='1')">
				dbt_vbd_agree = confirm('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_move_group_warning, {vb:raw vboptions.dbtech_vbdonate_donator_usergroup}}');
			<vb:else />
				dbt_vbd_agree = confirm('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_add_group_warning, {vb:raw vboptions.dbtech_vbdonate_donator_usergroup}}');
			</vb:if>
		}
		if (document.dbt_vbdmdf.dbt_vbd_mdf.value=='confirmandchangegroup')
		{
			<vb:if condition="($vboptions[dbtech_vbdonate_usergroup_type]=='1')">
				dbt_vbd_agree = confirm('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_confirm_move_warning, {vb:raw vboptions.dbtech_vbdonate_donator_usergroup}}');
			<vb:else />
				dbt_vbd_agree = confirm('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_confirm_add_warning, {vb:raw vboptions.dbtech_vbdonate_donator_usergroup}}');
			</vb:if>
		}
		if (dbt_vbd_agree)
		{
			return true;
		}
		else
		{
			return false;
		}
	}
<!--End Contribution List-->
<!--Start Contributions-->
	function dbt_pp_ceiling_amount()
	{
		dbt_vbd_pp_amt = document.dbt_vbd_pp_form.amount.value;
		dbtppminumamount = {vb:raw vboptions.dbtech_vbdonate_minamount_allowed};
			if (dbt_vbd_pp_amt.indexOf("|") > -1)
			{
				dbt_vbd_pp_amtpo = dbt_vbd_pp_amt.indexOf("|");
					dbt_vbd_pp_amtnr = dbt_vbd_pp_amt.substr(0,dbt_vbd_pp_amtpo);
			}
			else
			{
				dbt_vbd_pp_amtnr = dbt_vbd_pp_amt;
			}
			if (dbtppminumamount > dbt_vbd_pp_amtnr)
			{
				alert('{vb:rawphrase dbtech_vbdonate_minium_acc, {vb:raw vboptions.dbtech_vbdonate_minamount_allowed}, {vb:raw vboptions.dbtech_vbdonate_currency}}');
				return false;
			}
			else
			{
				document.getElementById("subheader").style.display = "none";
				document.getElementById("amountchooser").style.display = "none";
                                //document.getElementById("anonchooser").style.display = "none";
                                //document.getElementById("discchooser").style.display = "none";
                                document.getElementById("paymenttype").style.display = "none";
				document.getElementById("submit").style.display = "none";
				document.getElementById("redirectsubhead1").style.display = "block";
				document.getElementById("redirectblock").style.display = "block";
				document.getElementById("redirectsubhead2").style.display = "block";
				return true;
			}
	}
	function dbt_pp_revise_amount()
	{
		if (document.dbt_vbd_pp_form.chooser.value=='custom')
		{
			document.getElementById("contribute").style.display = "inline";
			document.dbt_vbd_pp_form.amount.value = '';
			document.dbt_vbd_pp_form.amount.focus();
		}
		else
		{
			document.getElementById("contribute").style.display = "none";
			document.dbt_vbd_pp_form.amount.value = document.dbt_vbd_pp_form.chooser.value;
		}
	}
<!--End Contributions-->
-->
</script>

<!--START BACK TO TOP-->
		<script type='text/javascript'>
			$(function(){$(window)
			.scroll(function(){if($(this)
			.scrollTop()!=0){$('#bttop')
			.fadeIn();}else{$('#bttop')
			.fadeOut();}});$('#bttop')
			.click(function(){$('body,html')
			.animate({scrollTop:0},400);});});
		</script>
<!--END BACK TO TOP-->

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase:
Their is a menu in the dropdown on the header of the
contribution goal block. The menu contains links to the
ACP, and the vBDonate various settings pages there.

As many webmasters know even though this is only viewable
by the usergroups that are vBDonate Admins, if you view the
source code of the site you still can see the link.

Really only makes a difference if you have renamed your admincp folder to something else.
So if you do not want this info viewable in the source code, disable the menu by setting this to "No"

In order for the edit icons to link properly, if you
renamed your admincp directory, enter the name here.

Set to "Yes" to allow anonymous contributions.
Set to "No" to not allow anonymous contributions.

Set to "Yes" to allow undisclosed contributions.
Set to "No" to not allow undisclosed contributions.

Select which amounts would you like users to be able to donate.

Suggested Only = Amounts you specify in the below option.

Suggested and Custom = Amounts you specify in the below option, and the user can input any amount that is equal to or above the amount set in the option "Minimum Amount Accepted"

Custom Only = The user can input any amount that is equal to or above the amount set in the option "Minimum Amount Accepted"

Select which usergroups can make anonymous contributions.
Allow Anonymous Contributions option above must be set to yes for the permissions to work.

Set to "Yes" to enable the system.
Set to "No" to disable the system.

Set to "Yes" to allow replies to the thread.
Set to "No" to not allow replies to the thread.

Only applies if you set Post As A New Thread? to Yes.

Set to "Yes" to have the posts count towards the posters post count.
Set to "No" to not have the posts count towards the posters post count.

Select the forum you want the new thread to be in.

This is the forum you wish the thread to be posted to if you choose to post as a thread.
If you choose to post as a reply to a thread, then it should be the forum the thread you are replying to is in is posted in.

Set to "Yes" to post as a new thread.
Set to "No" to post as a reply to a post.

Post ID is the id number of the post you are replying to if you choose to post as a reply to a post.

Only applies if you set Post As A New Thread? to No.

Enter the content of the eighth thread.

$username = The username of the person who contributed.
$amount = The amount the user contributed.
$currency = The prefix for the amount, ie: $ £ ¥ works based off what currency you accept.
$url = The base url for your site, ie: http://www.MYSITE.com
$bbtitle = The title of your site set in vboptions Site Name / URL / Contact Details

Set to "Yes" to center the award in the postbit.
Set to "No" to not center the award in the postbit.

Set to "Yes" to show a back to top button on the contributions list pages.
Set to "No" to not show a back to top button on the contributions list pages.

Note: The button will only show if you have 20 or more results shown per page.
Show A Back To Top Button On Contributions List Pages?
Enter the text you wish to display when a user hovers over the banner.

Select the location where you want the donation bar to be displayed at.

Global Above Forums = Right above the forums, below any other mods that run in that area.
Global Below NavBar = Right below the navbar, above any other mods that run in that area.
Forum Home Above Footer = Only on Forum Home right above the footer.

If a user clicks on the banner to go to the Donate Page
setting this to "self" will not open a new page in the browser,
setting this to "blank" will open a new page in the browser.

Set this to "No" to not show the banner to anyone not logged into the site.
This will save you bandwith so guests do not see the banner.

Show rotating banner on the following locations. Enter the THIS_SCRIPT location (separated by commas) you want the rotating banner to show.
Leave blank to show on all pages. Note: This may have an impact on performance.

To find a THIS_SCRIPT value:
Open the php file (locally, not the webpage!) you're trying to link to and look for this line in the code:
define('THIS_SCRIPT', 'ANYTEXTHERE');
Insert the ANYTEXTHERE into the text area to the right (without the quote marks).
Generally THIS_SCRIPT is is the same as the script file name, but is not always 100% true.

Set this to "Yes" if you are using the default banners and wish them to be resized
for smaller screen resolutions, or if you are using a "Fixed Style".

Set to "Yes" to show a slider banner system.
You can add content to the sliding banner by clicking on the
Sliding Banner Content menu on the DBTech - vBDonate - DashBoard.

Enter the time you want a banner to display before moving to the next one (in milliseconds).
1000 milliseconds is equal to 1 second, so entering 5000 here shows the banner
for 5 seconds before it moves on to the next banner in the rotation.
This is for the sliding banner only.

If you have purchased a Branding Free license
you may enter the key found in its Read me file.
Select which usergroups you do not want to be able to see the My Contributions List.
Can Not View My Donations List

Show donation amounts on the donation list.
vBDonate Admins will see them regardless of this setting.

Select which usergroups you wish to "NOT" see the Rotating Banner.
Default is set to not show to, Unregistered / Not Logged In, Users Awaiting Email Confirmation,
Users Awaiting Moderation and Banned Users.

It is recommended to not show it to guests or users not logged in,
in order to save on bandwidth, and save server resources.
Usergroups you wish to be able to see the who donated list.

The message that is presented if a user who is in a group not allowed to see the donation list.

This is in place just in case a user who is in a group not allowed, enters the url to the donation list in their browser manually.

vBDonate Admins will see them regardless of this setting, above usergroups will be able to view:

Don't Show Statistics = Show Nothing
Total Donations Only = Shows just the total donations made, something like Total Donations: 9
Total Donations And Total Amount = Shows total donations made and the total amount donated, something like Total Donations: 9, Total Amount: 205 USD

Usergroups that "CAN NOT" use Donate system.
Tick the boxes of the groups you do not want to be able to use the donation system.

The message that is presented if a user who is in a group not allowed to use the donation system.

This is in place just in case a user who is in a group not allowed, enters the url to the donation system in their browser manually.

Set the amount of "Max" characters you want to display
in the sideblocks for the contributors name.
The message that is presented when the modification is turned off via the above setting.

Set to "Yes" to send a PM to the user once the donation has been confirmed.

Edit PM Text Change PM Title
Change PM Body

Take care in editing the message.
You will see a {1} that will be replaced by the username of the person receiving the PM.
You will see a {2} that will be replaced with the date the donation was made on.
You will see a {3} that will be replaced with the currency type, ie: USD.
You will see a {4} that will be replaced with the amount that the user donated.
You will see a {5} that will be replaced with a link to the users contribution page.
You will see a {6}that will be replaced with the title of your site.
Send PM To User After Donation Is Confirmed?

Setting to "Yes" will send a pm to the user if you "Manually Added" a donation.

Edit PM Text Change PM Title
Change PM Body
Take care in editing the message.
You will see a {1} that will be replaced by the username of the person receiving the PM.
You will see a {2} that will be replaced with the date the donation was made on.
You will see a {3} that will be replaced with the currency type, ie: USD.
You will see a {4} that will be replaced with the amount that the user donated.
You will see a {5} that will be replaced with a link to the users contribution page.

To find a THIS_SCRIPT value:
Open the php file (locally, not the webpage!) you're trying to link to and look for this line in the code:
define('THIS_SCRIPT', 'ANYTEXTHERE');
Insert the ANYTEXTHERE into the text area to the right (without the quote marks).
Generally THIS_SCRIPT is is the same as the script file name, but is not always 100% true.
